technique_name: Feature Selection using Bat Optimization Algorithm (FSBOA)
one_liner: FSBOA selects the most relevant features from software metrics to enhance fault prediction accuracy while reducing dimensionality.
how_it_works: FSBOA employs the Bat Optimization Algorithm to identify and select important features from a large set of software metrics. It initializes a population of bats, evaluates their fitness based on the selected features, and updates their positions and velocities using principles of echolocation. The algorithm iteratively refines the feature set to improve prediction accuracy and mitigate overfitting.

steps: Initialize bat positions and velocities randomly.
Evaluate the fitness of each bat based on the selected features.
Update bat velocities and positions using echolocation principles.
Select the best position as the global best.
Perform local search around the global best position.
Repeat for a predefined number of iterations.
algorithm.input_format: Software metrics dataset with features representing various software attributes.
algorithm.output_format: Subset of features that are most relevant for predicting software faults.

weaknesses: May require significant computational resources for large datasets.
